alert.note: Alert for Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central York and southeastern Carroll Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 9 miles east of Wolfeboro, or 14 miles southeast of Ossipee, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ossipee, Effingham, Wolfeboro, Acton, Freedom, Brookfield, Wakefield, Newfield, Shapleigh, Middleton, Tuftonboro, Parsonsfield and Milton. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
